snippet: The state passed a law approving the sale of marijuana for medical purposes in 2012, but applicants for dispensaries are having a hard time persuading localities to let them set up shop.
abstract: Connecticut passed law approving sale of marijuana for medical purposes in 2012, but the drug is still not available for purchase in the state; applicants for dispensaries are having a hard time persuading localities to let them set up shop.
lead_paragraph: The state passed a law approving the sale of marijuana for medical purposes in 2012, but applicants for dispensaries are having a hard time persuading localities to let them set up shop.

headline.main: Connecticut Allows Medical Marijuana, but Sellers Encounter Hurdles
headline.print_headline: Connecticut Allows Medical Marijuana, but Sellers Encounter Hurdles
